summary: The Ecosystem Architecture series explores the evolution of the 'ecosystem' concept from a biological community bound by space and time to a broader metaphor for decentralized, non-hierarchical structures in various fields. It advocates for new practices to build decentralized organizations that transcend traditional frameworks.
excerpt: Ecosystem describes a biological community bound by space and time. Its metaphorical use signifies a shift towards decentralized structures. Ecosystem Architecture emerges as a new practice to cultivate thriving, dispersed organizations.
